doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Reports on protein proteolytic enzyme or reagent cleavage sites

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Molecular weight data for amino acids

xhtml:div.label: Enzymes and reagents Trypsin Lys-c Arg-c Asp-n V8-bicarb V8-phosph Chymotrypsin Cnbr
Use monoisotopic weights Yes No

Allow unfavoured cuts?
Yes No
Trypsin will not normally cut after 'KR' if they are followed by any of 'KRIFLP'. Lys-C will not normally cut after 'K' if it is followed by 'P'. Arg-C will not normally cut after 'R' if it is followed by 'P'. V8-bicarb will not normally cut after 'E' if it is followed by any of 'KREP'. V8-phosph will not normally cut after 'DE' if they are followed by 'P'. Chymotrypsin will not normally cut after 'FYWLM' if they are followed by 'P'. Specifying unfavoured shows these unfavoured cuts as well as the favoured ones.

Allow ragging?
Yes No
Allows semi-specific and non-specific digestion. This option is particularly useful for generating lists of peptide sequences for protein identification using mass-spectrometry.
Ragging value (value from 1 to 4) None Nterm Cterm Nterm or cterm

Show overlapping partials?
Yes No
Used for partial digestion. Shows all cuts from favoured cut sites plus 1..3, 2..4, 3..5 etc but not (e.g.) 2..5. Overlaps are therefore fragments with exactly one potential cut site within it.

Show all partials?
Yes No
As for overlap but fragments containing more than one potential cut site are included.
Name of the report file
Choose the report output format Dasgff Dbmotif Diffseq Embl Excel Feattable Genbank Gff Listfile Motif Nametable Codata Regions Seqtable Simple Srs Swiss Table Tagseq

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Molecular weight data for amino acids

Trypsin will not normally cut after 'KR' if they are followed by any of 'KRIFLP'. Lys-C will not normally cut after 'K' if it is followed by 'P'. Arg-C will not normally cut after 'R' if it is followed by 'P'. V8-bicarb will not normally cut after 'E' if it is followed by any of 'KREP'. V8-phosph will not normally cut after 'DE' if they are followed by 'P'. Chymotrypsin will not normally cut after 'FYWLM' if they are followed by 'P'. Specifying unfavoured shows these unfavoured cuts as well as the favoured ones.
Allows semi-specific and non-specific digestion. This option is particularly useful for generating lists of peptide sequences for protein identification using mass-spectrometry.
Used for partial digestion. Shows all cuts from favoured cut sites plus 1..3, 2..4, 3..5 etc but not (e.g.) 2..5. Overlaps are therefore fragments with exactly one potential cut site within it.
As for overlap but fragments containing more than one potential cut site are included.
